itemDescription: English organizer of maternity and nursing services in Africa

wikipedia_page.main: Joan Alice Katherine Grigg, Baroness Altrincham born Joan Dickson-Poynder (11 September 1897 – 1987) was a British organiser of maternity and nursing services in Kenya. She disagreed with the Governor of Kenya (her husband) about race issues and she established medical facilities for all races.

response: Karen and Bror were officially divorced in 1925. Karen would go to Government House where she had befriended Joan Grigg who was the bored wife of the governor. Grigg would in time create a charity to create hospitals in Kenya.

link_mentions.page: List of colonial governors and administrators of Kenya
response: *Health care established for all races (by Joan Grigg)
